titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jack L. Demmons Collection of Photographs of Bonner, MontanaCirca 1890s-1960s
Demmons (Jack L.) collection of photographs of Bonner, Montana.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Erin Baucom

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Erin Baucom 2018
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard 2nd edition.)

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Jack L. Demmons Collection of Photographs of Bonner, Montana
did.abstract: Assembled in the mid-1970s by Bonner School Superintendent Jack L. Demmons, this collection of approximately 1,600 photographs depicts life in and around Bonner, Montana, from the late 1800s through the 1960s.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jack L. Demmons was the Superintendent of the Bonner School from 1974 to 1985. During his tenure, Jack Demmons started collecting photos documenting the history of Bonner, Montana.

scopecontent.p: Assembled in the mid-1970's by Bonner School Superintendent Jack L. Demmons, this collection of approximately 1,600 photographs depicts life in and around Bonner, Montana, from the late 1800s through the 1960s. Images and descriptive labels were affixed to photoboards for public display. The photoboards and labels were scanned in sections in 2007 with the goal of providing online access to the images.

arrangement.p: This collection is one series of photographs and are listed as they appear on the original photoboards.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and the University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright was not transferred to the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: Jack L. Demmons Collection of Photographs of Bonner, Montana, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: The original photoboards were transported from Bonner School to the University of Montana for scanning. The photoboards were returned to Bonner School after scanning was completed. The digital files remained at the University of Montana's Archives and Special Collections.

acqinfo.p: The digital images were created by, and ownership shared with, the Mansfield Library at the University of Montana in 2007.

processinfo.p: Original photoboards scanned using a Colortrac Ltd. 5480e wide format scanner at 600 ppi. Images cropped into individual master TIFFs. Derivative images created using Photoshop CS2. These images are available online through the Montana Memory Project's Jack L. Demmons Photographs of Bonner, Montana.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

did.unittitle: Posing by the Mullan Monument at the confluence of the Blackfoot and Clark Fork Rivers

note.p: Photo caption reads: Mullan's Monument. Mullan encamped there during the winter of 1859-60 (sic). The monument was near the confluence of the Blackfoot and Clark Fork Rivers, on the west bank across from Milltown. It is now located by the old highway, about a 1/2 mile past East Missoula going towards Missoula. (Label in upper left corner reads "69"; four women stand in front of the fence surrounding the monument; railroad tracks, teepee burner and smokestack in background; monument was later moved into Missoula at intersection of Orange, Main and Front Streets; then in late 1990s moved back out to Bonner area, on highway west of Blackfoot River across highway from Town Pump truck stop). Image from Photoboard #19

Photo caption reads: The building on the right was the home bakery as well as the Beadle residence. The building on the left was a photographic studio before 1910 and later served to house a boxing ring, shoe repair and other enterprises. The Beadle residence is still standing, but the other building has been torn down. (Label in upper left corner reads "111"; Milltown. building on left has Royal Crown Cola sign over door; Coca Cola signs under the two windows; and indecipherable signs above windows). Image from Photoboard #22

Photo caption reads: Newspaper headline, 1928. (The Daily Missoulian, Monday morning, December 31, 1928. Page 1 banner headline reads "One killed at Milltown fire. Hugh Elliott is electrocuted while fighting $5,000 Riverside Market Blaze. (Article headlines in far right column: "Five men hurt two families are homeless. Injuries and death caused by contact of victims with live wire that had fallen from building. Missoula Firemen respond to call. Structure is totally destroyed by flames, which are stopped from spreading after bitter fight"). Image from Photoboard #22

Associate Editors: 8th grade, Kenneth Collard ; 7th Grade: Jeannette LaForge ; 6th grade: Toini K... ; 5th grade: Chaley H.... (cut off). Honor roll: 8th-- Scholarship - Doris Wenworth, Kauko Kinnonen, Jennie Jacobson, Aili Karkainen, Elsie Erb. Attendance - Richard Graven, Kenneth Collard, Go.... Boileau, Mary Hamma, Aili Karkainen, Violet LaTrielle. 7th - Scholarship: Mariam Egan, Doris Kniffen, Bond Brandt, Laura Brandt, Edwin Rickard, Jack Lubrecht, William Clemens. Attendance: Melvin Akin, Uno Kolppa, Melvin Ma..., Jack Lubrecht, Ellen Johnson, Jenny Peterson, Clara Peterson, Doris Kn..., Florence McCloskey. 6th - Scholarship: Jack Moe, Dorothea Applequist, Kathleen Shawhan, Toini Kari, Onnie Hamma. Attendance: Onnie Hamma. 5th -- Moses Rhoades, Vivian Danielson, Beatrice Haaglund, Charley Hamma. Attendance: Moses Rhaods, Carl Swanson, Leif (Anderson?), Beatrice Haaglund, Charley Ha...) Image from Photoboard #69

did.unittitle: Part of 1918 newspaper article about the opening of Bonner School

note.p: Photo caption reads: 1918. (Part of newspaper story cut off in first paragraph: "Bonner School Ready For Bell. Thoroughly Renovated During Summer Months; Term Opens September 2. Bonner, Aug. 15 - Special. - The teachers and pupils of the Bonner school will resume school work September 2 in a building that has been thoroughly renovated and repaired to better accommodate the work. The entire interior of the building is being cleaned and the walls tinted according to school room requirements. In addition to this work part of the roof has been reshingled while a class room is being provided at the rear end of the upper corridor...") Image from Photoboard #69

Photo caption reads: 1928. The Barrel was a favorite playground pastime. (Front of old school; snow; swing set; barrel mounted on low 8-foot rail, appears to slide back and forth; old car parked on right side of school around corner). Image from Photoboard #69

did.unittitle: East entrance of the Bonner School in 1926 with piles of slabwood used for heating

note.p: Photo caption reads: The Bonner School east entrance. Note the piles of slabwood which were burned for fuel. The wood was hauled from the mill in a wheelbarrow. On cold days, first Paul Teague and then Frank Dufresne manned the four furnaces 24 hours. 1926. (View from Piltzville side of old school; Catholic church to the left of the school; wood piles between the two buildings). Image from Photoboard #69

Photo caption reads: George T. Boileau. Born at Lothrop, Montana Sept. 1912 and Died at Riverton, Washington Feb. 25, 1965 (Photocopy of front and back of George's funeral announcement; his picture in bishop's vestments on right; announcement on left reads, in part, "In Memory of The Most Reverend George T. Boileau, S.J. Titular Bishop of Ausuccura, Coadjutor to the Bishop of Fairbanks. Born at Lothrope, Montana, September 10, 1912. Entered the Society of Jesus at Sheridan, Oregon, September 5, 1936. Ordained priest at San Francisco, California, June 13, 1948; Consecrated Bishop of Glenallen, Alaska, July 31, 1964. Died at Riverton, Washington February 25, 1965 ... Pontifical Mass of Requiem 10:30 A.M. March 2, 1965. Cathedral of St. James, Seattle Washington. Pontifical Mass of Requiem March 4, 1956, Pro-Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception, Fairbanks, Alaska. Interment: Fairbanks, Alaska ...") Image from Photoboard #121

Photo caption reads: LCDR. Mike Bouchard, U.S. Navy. Shot down Laos, 20 Dec. 1968 M.I.A. (Official Navy photograph; matted; hole in photo near left shoulder; manila paper attachment in lower left corner shows school photo of Mike with typewritten words to the left of photo: â€œLieutenant Commander Mike Bouchard, shown at the time of his graduation from the Bonner School in 1952. He lived in Bonner. Mike was declared missing in action in December, 1968. At that time he was flying an A-6E aircraft on a strike mission in Southeast Asia.â€) Image from Photoboard #123
